snippet: A draft decision by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services would extend coverage for CT scans to Medicare beneficiaries who smoked at least a pack a day for 30 years or the equivalent.
abstract: Medicare will cover annual screenings for lung cancer for four million older Americans with long history of heavy smoking; draft decision by Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services will extend coverage for CT scans to Medicare beneficiaries who smoked at least a pack a day for 30 years or the equivalent.
lead_paragraph: A draft decision by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services would extend coverage for CT scans to Medicare beneficiaries who smoked at least a pack a day for 30 years or the equivalent.

headline.main: Medicare Proposes Paying for Lung Cancer Screenings for Older Longtime Smokers
headline.print_headline: Medicare Proposes Paying for Lung Cancer Screenings for Older Longtime Smokers

keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
keywords.name: organizations
